  • Method Details

    • login

      public boolean login(User user) throws DAOException
      Attempts to log in a user by verifying their email and password in the database.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object representing the user's login information.
      Returns:
      true if the login was successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an error while interacting with the database.

    • emailExist

      public boolean emailExist(User user) throws DAOException
      Checks whether a given email address already exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      The - user object contains email to check for existence.
      Returns:
      true if the email address already exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an error while interacting with the database.

      public boolean emailAlreadyExist(String email) throws DAOException
      Checks whether a given email address already exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address to check for existence.
      Returns:
      true if the email address already exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an error while interacting with the database.

    • register

      public boolean register(User user) throws DAOException

      Parameters:
      user - The User object representing the user to be registered.
      Returns:
      true if the registration was successful, false otherwise.

    • update

      public boolean update(User user, String userEmail) throws DAOException
      Updates a user's information in the database.
      Parameters:
      The - User object containing the updated user information.
      userEmail - The email address of the user to be updated.
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an error while interacting with the database.

    • delete

      public boolean delete(String userEmail, int isDeleted) throws DAOException
      Marks a user as deleted or undeleted in the database.
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email address of the user to be marked.
      isDeleted - The value indicating whether the user should be marked as deleted (1) or not deleted (0).
      Returns:
      true if the marking was successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DAOException - If there's an error while interacting with the database.
